admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
This public enterprise rationalization
            project rests on the principle that competition, or similar
            pressures, promotes the continuing pursuit of efficiency.
            With this objective of efficiency in mind, a broad set of
            measures were identified with the following objectives.
            First, financial independence and accountability of public
            enterprises must be promoted. Second, their administrative
            and managerial accountability must be developed. Finally,
            the State must divest of activities that could be more
            effectively carried out by the private sector. It is
            expected that this project would enhance the productivity of
            public enterprises, reduce their dependence on scarce
            budgetary resources, and rationalize the role of the State
            in the economy by concentrating its attention on policy
            making and the provision of essential services.
